paragraph.paragraph:
When you create a new project, icons in the vxurfNewProjectDialog 0 New Project dialog box and Add Project dialog box represent the available project types and their templates. The project template that is associated with the project icon you choose determines the output type and other options available for that project.
Note: Some project types listed in this topic are not available in the Free Edition of EiffelEnvision. For more information, see ../../../introduction/editions.xmlEiffelEnvision Edition Features.

The following table lists the types of projects available for EiffelEnvision.
600 4 Available EiffelEnvision Projects
Project Template Used to Create
Windows Application Template Traditional standalone Windows application or a rich front-end to a distributed Web application, Using vboriCreatingForms 0 Windows Forms . For more information, see vboriCreatingStandaloneAppsVB 0 Creating Windows Applications .
Console Application Template Command-line applications
Eiffel Graphical Application Template A standalone Windows application using the url*EiffelVision 2 platform independent graphical library. Project are also ready to be designed using the url*EiffelVision 2 graphical builder.
Blank Eiffel Graphical Application Template A standalone Windows application using the url*EiffelVision 2 platform independent graphical library.
Windows Eiffel Application Template A standalone Windows application using the url*Windows Eiffel Library (WEL).
Class Library Template Reusable class or component that can be shared with other projects. This project type is considered windowless and will not contain a vboriCreatingForms 0 Windows Forms class. For more information, see vbconComponentClassDesign 0 Component Classes .
Eiffel Class Library Template Reusable class or component that can be shared with other projects, specifically designed for reuse by other EiffelEnvision projects. Eiffel Class Library projects are also known in Eiffel as ../configuring/adding_references/precompiled_libraries.xmlPrecompiled Libraries.
Empty Project Template Configurable empty project, with rudimentary options. For creating application or libraries by specifying the root class and creation routine.
